intro: Pedicularis castellana, commonly known as the castle beard or mountain beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from red to orange, often resembling the beards of ancient warriors. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a whorl around the stem. Pedicularis castellana thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
